Dataset_Info.Funding_Info: NOAA Climate Program Office; NOAA Ocean Acidification Program

Variable.Description_of_Variable: Mole fraction of CO2 in the equilibrator headspace (dry) at equilibrator temperature (ppm)
Mole fraction of CO2 measured in dry outside air (ppm)
Mole fraction of CO2 in outside air associated with each water analysis. These values are interpolated between the bracketing averaged good xCO2_ATM analyses (ppm)
Barometric pressure in the equilibrator headspace (hPa)
Barometric pressure measured outside, corrected to sea level (hPa)
Sea surface salinity on Practical Salinity Scale (o/oo)
Fugacity of CO2 in sea water at SST and 100% humidity (μatm)
Fugacity of CO2 in air corresponding to the interpolated xCO2 at SST and 100% humidity (μatm)
Sea water fCO2 minus interpolated air fCO2 (μatm)
Quality control flag for fCO2 values (2=good, 3=questionable)
Quality control subflag for fCO2 values, provides explanation when QC flag=3

Equilibrator_Design.Equilibrator_Type: Spray head above dynamic pool with thermal jacket
Equilibrator_Design.Drying_Method_for_CO2_in_water: Gas stream passes through a thermoelectric condenser (~5 °C) and then through a Perma Pure (Nafion) dryer before reaching the analyzer (90% dry).
Equilibrator_Design.Additional_Information: Primary equilibrator is vented through a secondary equilibrator.

CO2_in_Marine_Air.Measurement: Yes, 5 readings in a group every 3.5 hours
CO2_in_Marine_Air.Location_and_Height: Mast above the bridge, ~18 meters above sea surface
CO2_in_Marine_Air.Drying_Method: Gas stream passes through a thermoelectric condenser (~5 °C) and then through a Perma Pure (Nafion) dryer before reaching the analyzer (90% dry).

CO2_Sensor.Manufacturer_of_Calibration_Gas: Std 1: JA02280, 233.46 ppm, owned by AOML, used every ~4.5 hours. Std 2: JB03651, 306.46 ppm, owned by AOML, used every ~4.5 hours. Std 3: JB03592, 422.24 ppm, owned by AOML, used every ~4.5 hours. Std 4: JA02647, 561.16 ppm, owned by AOML, used every ~4.5 hours. Std 5: LL100000, 0.00 ppm, owned by AOML, used every ~22.5 hours.
CO2_Sensor.CO2_Sensor_Calibration: The analyzer is calibrated every 3.5 hours with field standards that in turn were calibrated with primary standards that are directly traceable to the WMO scale. The zero gas is ultra-high purity air.
CO2_Sensor.Other_Comments: Instrument is located in an air-conditioned laboratory. Ultra-High Purity air (0.0 ppm CO2) and the high standard gas are used to zero and span the LI-COR analyzer.
CO2_Sensor.Method_References: Pierrot, D., C. Neil, K. Sullivan, R. Castle, R. Wanninkhof, H. Lueger, T. Johannessen, A. Olsen, R. A. Feely, and C. E. Cosca (2009), Recommendations for autonomous underway pCO2 measuring systems and data reduction routines, Deep-Sea Res II, 56, 512-522.

Sea_Surface_Temperature.Location: After sea water pump, ~3 m below sea surface
Sea_Surface_Temperature.Other_Comments: Manufacturer's Resolution is taken as Precision; Maintained by the ship.

Equilibrator_Temperature.Location: Inserted into equilibrator ~5 cm below water level

Equilibrator_Pressure.Location: Attached to equilibrator headspace. Differential pressure reading from Setra 239 attached to the equilibrator headspace is added to the pressure reading from the LICOR, which is measured by an external Setra 270 connected to the exit of the analyzer.
Equilibrator_Pressure.Other_Comments: Manufacturer's Resolution is taken as Precision.

Atmospheric_Pressure.Location: On mast above the bridge at ~18 m above sea surface water
Atmospheric_Pressure.Other_Comments: Manufacturer's Resolution is taken as Precision; Maintained by ship.

Sea_Surface_Salinity.Location: In dry lab after a debubbler, next to CO2 system
Sea_Surface_Salinity.Other_Comments: Manufacturer's Resolution is taken as Precision; Maintained by the ship.

x_tags.Additional_Information: The analytical system operated well during this cruise. Due to damage in the shipyard prior to the restart of this field season, the airline was not usable so no ATM analyses were done. Occasionally, the ship's SCS sensors were not recorded. To estimate missing barometer values, 0.59 mbar was added to the LICOR pressure. Missing SSS and SST values were estimated from surrounding good values. Twice during this cruise, operations had to be suspended for severe weather. Original Data Location: http://www.aoml.noaa.gov/ocd/ocdweb/equinox/equinox_introduction.html. Full unprocessed data files from analytical instrument including flow information plus meteorological and TSG data at time of sampling can be obtained upon request.
